## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

## Inline code
```{r}
a <- c(1,2,3)
```

The sum of vector $a$ is `r sum(a)`.

## Run Code

```{r}
x = 3
x
```

## Order Matters

```{r}
x = 3
y = 4
print(c(x,y))
```

```{r}
x+y
x-y
x*y
x/y
x^y
x%%y
```

```{r, eval=F}
log(x)
abs(x-y)
exp(x)
```

## Objects

```{r}
# Numeric Vector Named x
x = c(3,2,1,5,7,8)
# Prints x
x
# Third Element of x
x[3]
# Character Vector Named y
y = c("H","T","H","T","H","T")
# Fifth Element of y
y[5]
# 3 * 2 Matrix Named z
z = matrix(c(3,2,1,5,7,8),
           nrow=2,ncol=3,byrow=T)
# Prints z
z
# First Row of z
z[1,]
# First and Third Columns of z
z[,c(1,3)]
```

## Data Frame
```{r}
tbl = tibble(x=x, y=y)
tbl
```

```{r}
df = data.frame(x=x,y=y)
df
```


## Plot

```{r}
plot1 <- ggplot(data=tbl) +
  geom_point(aes(x=x,y=y))
```



## Function
```{r}
x = rnorm(1000,5,10)
?rnorm
mean(x)
sd(x)
quantile(x)
quantile(x,probs=c(0.05,0.95))
```

```{r}
quant.x = quantile(x, probs=c(0.05, 0.95))
data.x = tibble(x=x)
ggplot(data=data.x) +
  geom_density(aes(x=x)) +
  geom_vline(xintercept=quant.x,col='red')
```
